sec.title: Long Phi Hoang
sec.p: is postdoc researcher at the Water Systems and Global Change group, Wageningen University. His main research interests include: hydrology, adaptive water management, climate change and river delta management.

sec.title: Robbert Biesbroek
sec.p: is assistant professor at the Public Administration and Policy Group, Wageningen University. His main research interests include: public policy and governance, complex decision making, neo-institutionalism, policy dynamics, climate change adaptation, social mechanisms of policy change.

sec.title: Van Pham Dang Tri
sec.p: is associate professor at the College of Environment and Natural Resources, Can Tho University. His main research interests include: integrated water resources management, irrigation, hydrodynamics modelling, impacts of climate change on behaviours of the different river networks, and on agriculture and aquaculture in the Vietnamese Mekong Delta.

sec.title: Matti Kummu
sec.p: is assistant professor at the Water & Development Research Group, Aalto University. His main research interests include: interactions between human activities and water resources, particularly how global food production is impacted by resource scarcity, and what are the possible measures to alleviate scarcity.

sec.title: Michelle T. H. van Vliet
sec.p: is assistant professor at the Water Systems and Global Change group, Wageningen University. Her main research interests include: modelling of global change impacts and adaptation on global water stress and cross-sectoral conflicts for surface waters availability and quality.

sec.title: Rik Leemans
sec.p: is professor at the Environmental Systems Analysis group, Wageningen University. His main research interests include: ecosystems and biodiversity and accentuates resilience, vulnerability and sustainability.

sec.title: Pavel Kabat
sec.p: is professor of Earth System Sciences, Wageningen University, and director general at the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis. His main research interests include: earth system science and global change, with a specific focus on land-atmosphere interactions, climate hydrology, the water cycle, and water resources.

sec.title: Fulco Ludwig
sec.p: is proffessor at the Water Systems and Global Change group, Wageningen University. His main research interests include: global change impacts and adaptation in relation to water, food and energy resources and natural ecosystems.
